options: A. Requires a long learning curve
C. Can be done through a single incision

question: Regarding Marcus Gunn jaw-winking, which is incorrect:
options: A. Commonly involves the ipsilateral internal pterygoid muscle
B. Amplitude is greater in patients who have more severe ptosis
C. Often becomes less noticeable with increasing age.
D. May require levator ablation as treatment

question: Blepharophimosis is generally associated with, one is false:

options: A. Marcus Gunn jaw winking syndrome

question: A patient diagnosed with myasthenia gravis (MG) requires:
options: A. MRI scan of the brain
B. B-scan ultrasonography of the eye and orbit
C. CT scan of the chest

question: Jaw winking is most commonly due to synkinesis of which two cranial nerves?

options: A. It runs from the posterior lacrimal crest medially to the lateral orbital tubercle laterally
B. Its superfcial portion inserts into the orbicularis muscle and subcutaneous tissues
C. It originates in close proximity to the superior rectus origin, just above the annulus of Zinn.
D. The muscular portion is shorter than the aponeurotic portion.
